artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Sumida Ryōko; Publisher: Daikokuya Kinnosuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 134.17; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 288.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: standing woman bending forward, with long loose hair, with a strand in her mouth, holding strands in each hand in front of her; woman wears garments in blue and grey with purple flowers and red and white stripes; waves behind woman at her skirts; dark blue ground, with some falling pink flowers and petals
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales from Japan and China (Wakan hyaku monogatari 和漢百物語)
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Kiyo-hime
